This website will provide technical information on CMAR's Coastal Monitoring Program and Data Governance initiatives.

The content in under development and should be considered a **DRAFT**.


CMAR's Coastal Monitoring Program (CMP) is an ongoing data collection effort that aims to support and inform science-based development of Nova Scotia's marine coastal industry, guide government policy and management decisions, encourage environmental stewardship, and ensure preparedness for climate change. 

Content to include:

- 3 branches
- data access
- data governance
- sensor strings
- CMARverse
- sensors used (see DMP)
- data processing
- data management plan
